intro: Linaria tristis var. amoi, commonly known as the Amoy toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
